proteomics.Description: Controlled vocabulary to facilitate data exchange and archiving in the field of mass spectrometry-based proteomics.
proteomics.Standard Name: HUPO PSI Mass Spectrometry Controlled Vocabulary

proteomics.Description: XML-based format, which is designed to hold the data output of a mass spectrometer as well as a systematic description of the conditions under which this data was acquired and transformed.
Standard rich HDF5-based format for raw mass spectrometry data storage based upon the mzML XML file format, re-using a subset of the features.
Tab-delimited file format for mass spec-derived omics data containing the minimal information required to evaluate the results of an experiment.
Exchange format (XML) for results of identification and quantitation processes for proteins, peptides and protein modifications from mass spectrometry and crosslinking experiments.

Unified format for protein and nucleotide sequence databases to be used by sequence search engines and other associated tools (spectra library search tools, sequence alignment software, data repositories, etc). This format enables consistent extraction, display and processing of information such as protein/nucleotide sequence database entry identifier, description, taxonomy, etc. across software platforms.

Multi-part key identifier for identifying mass spectra contained in public data repositories that encodes the dataset, the MS Run, the scan number and the proposed peptidoform and charge of the ions responsible for the spectrum.
Formal standard file format to store and distribute spectral libraries aimed towards developers of spectral library search tools and resources.

proteomics.Active Affiliation(s): PRIDE Consortium, HUPO - Proteomics Standards Initiative
proteomics.Description: Tab-delimited format that describes the sample characteristics and the relationships between samples and data files included in a dataset.
Standard format for reporting and exchanging quality-related information in biological mass spectrometry.
proteomics.Standard Name: Reporting and exchange format for mass spectrometry quality control data

proteomics.Description: Specification represents the consortium reached by both groups in order to standardise the representation of proteoforms/peptidoforms supporting the main proteomics approaches, including both bottom-up (focused on peptides/peptidoforms) and top down (focused on proteins/proteoforms) approaches.

Specification for a fragment ion peak annotation format for mass spectra, focused on peptides. This provides for a standardized format for describing the origin of fragment ions to be used in spectral libraries, other formats that aim to describe fragment ions, and software tools that annotate fragment ions.
The context-sensitive nature of transcriptome, metabolome and proteome data necessitates the capture of a richer set of metadata (data about the data) than is required for basic genetic sequence.

Guidelines for reporting the use of mass spectrometry in proteomics
